It typically follows a statement about a lesser action or condition, then introduces a statement about a more extreme or less likely action or condition.
formation: Lesser Condition + 何况 + More Extreme or Unlikely Condition

examples.cn: 他连最基础的问题都回答不出来，何况更复杂的问题。
examples.pinyin: Tā lián zuì jīchǔ de wèntí dōu huídá bù chūlái, hékuàng gèng fùzá de wèntí.
examples.en: He can't even answer the most basic questions, let alone more complex ones.

examples.cn: 我不会说法语，何况写法语。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bù huì shuō Fǎyǔ, hékuàng xiě Fǎyǔ.
examples.en: I can't speak French, much less write it.

examples.cn: 他甚至没时间看电视，何况看一本长篇小说。
examples.pinyin: Tā shènzhì méi shíjiān kàn diànshì, hékuàng kàn yī běn chángpiān xiǎoshuō.
examples.en: He doesn't even have time to watch TV, let alone read a long novel.

examples.cn: 我连煎蛋都不会，何况煮一顿大餐。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ lián jiān dàn dōu bù huì, hékuàng zhǔ yī dùn dàcān.
examples.en: I can't even fry an egg, much less cook a full meal.

title: 倒不如 (dào bù rú) - Might as well...
short_explanation: This expression is used to make a comparison and suggest that one choice is superior to another.
long_explanation: The Mandarin phrase '倒不如 (dào bù rú)' is used to draw a comparison between two options, and suggest that one might be a better or the preferable choice over the other. It is commonly used to express a sense of concession or preference. It translates as 'might as well' or 'better off'. It suggests a comparison where the second option is preferable.
formation: Situation A + 倒不如 + Situation B

examples.cn: 你在这里等我两个小时，倒不如回家做你的作业。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ zài zhèlǐ děng wǒ liǎng gè xiǎoshí, dào bù rú huí jiā zuò nǐ de zuòyè.
examples.en: You might as well go home and do your homework instead of waiting for me here for two hours.

examples.cn: 我花这么多钱买这个手机，倒不如买一个新的电脑。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ huā zhème duō qián mǎi zhège shǒujī, dào bù rú mǎi yīgè xīn de diànnǎo.
examples.en: I might as well buy a new laptop instead of spending so much money on this phone.

examples.cn: 你做这么多不喜欢的工作，倒不如找一份你真心喜欢的。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ zuò zhème duō bù xǐhuan de gōngzuò, dào bù rú zhǎo yīfèn nǐ zhēnxīn xǐhuan de.
examples.en: You might as well look for a job you really like instead of doing so many jobs you dislike.

examples.cn: 你早起赶火车，倒不如今晚就住在火车站附近。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ zǎo qǐ gǎn huǒchē, dào bù rú jīnwǎn jiù zhù zài huǒchē zhàn fùjìn.
examples.en: You might as well stay near the train station tonight instead of getting up early to catch the train.

title: 不妨 (bùfáng) - Might as well...
short_explanation: Used to suggest or propose a course of action that could be beneficial or won't cause harm.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '不妨 (bùfáng)' is a modal verb suggesting an action that could be taken without potential harm, or might even bring some benefits. It translates as 'might as well...' in English. It carries a sense of casual suggestion, so it's commonly used among friends, family, or co-workers when discussing various options for action.

examples.cn: 你不妨试试这个新的手机应用，它可能会对你有帮助。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ bùfáng shìshì zhège xīn de shǒujī yìngyòng, tā kěnéng huì duì nǐ yǒu bāngzhù.
examples.en: You might as well try this new mobile app, it might be helpful to you.

examples.cn: 既然你有时间，不妨去图书馆看看那本书。
examples.pinyin: Jìrán nǐ yǒu shíjiān, bùfáng qù túshūguǎn kàn kàn nà běn shū.
examples.en: Since you have time, you might as well go to the library and look at that book.

examples.cn: 她不妨考虑明年出国深造，在外国的经历对她的发展肯定有利。
examples.pinyin: Tā bùfáng kǎolǜ míngnián chūguó shēnzào, zài wàiguó de jīnglì duì tā de fāzhǎn kěndìng yǒulì.
examples.en: She might as well consider going abroad to further her studies next year. The experience of being in a foreign country will certainly be beneficial to her development.

examples.cn: 我们不妨晚点再离开，现在高峰期车太多。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen bùfáng wǎndiǎn zài líkāi, xiànzài gāofēng qī chē tài duō.
examples.en: We might as well leave later, there are too many cars during peak hours now.

title: 既然...就... (jìrán... jiù...) - Since... then...
short_explanation: The construction '既然...就...' expresses that Since A is true, then B should logically follow.
long_explanation: The phrase '既然...就...' is a standard Chinese grammatical structure used to express digital causation. It is equivalent to the English phrase 'since...then...'. The cause or premise mentioned after '既然' leads to the result or conclusion that follows '就'. The usage of this structure usually implies that the fact expressed after '既然' is an acknowledged or indisputable fact.
formation: 既然 + Statement A (Fact), 就 + Statement B (Result or Conclusion)

examples.cn: 既然你已经决定去了，我就不劝你留下来了。
examples.pinyin: Jìrán nǐ yǐjīng juédìng qùle, wǒ jiù bù quàn nǐ liú xiàlái le.
examples.en: Since you have already decided to go, I won't persuade you to stay.

examples.cn: 既然她不喜欢这件衣服，就不要买了。
examples.pinyin: Jìrán tā bù xǐhuān zhè jiàn yīfu, jiù bù yào mǎi le.
examples.en: Since she doesn't like this dress, don't buy it.

examples.cn: 既然你不懂这个问题，我们就重新解释一遍。
examples.pinyin: Jìrán nǐ bù dǒng zhè gè wèntí, wǒmen jiù chóngxīn jiěshì yībiàn.
examples.en: Since you don't understand this problem, we will explain it again.

examples.cn: 既然走了这么远，我们就坚持到底吧。
examples.pinyin: Jìrán zǒu le zhème yuǎn, wǒmen jiù jiānchí dàodǐ ba.
examples.en: Since we have come so far, let's persist to the end.

title: 在...方面 (zài... fāngmiàn) - In terms of...
short_explanation: Used to specify or focus on a particular aspect or field in a statement.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '在...方面 (zài... fāngmiàn)' is used to emphasize or specify a particular aspect, field, or domain in a given conversation, statement, or situation. It is similar to saying 'in terms of' or 'with regards to' in English. This phrase allows for specific and detailed communication when discussing different aspects or facets of a concept or topic.
formation: Subject + 在 + Aspect/Field + 方面 + Verb + Object

examples.cn: 在音乐方面，他的技艺无人能及。
examples.pinyin: Zài yīnyuè fāngmiàn, tā de jìyì wúrén néng jí.
examples.en: In terms of music, his skills are unmatched.

examples.cn: 我们在环保方面做得还不够。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zài huánbǎo fāngmiàn zuò dé hái bùgòu.
examples.en: We are not doing enough in terms of environmental protection.

examples.cn: 在学习语言方面，持续练习是关键。
examples.pinyin: Zài xuéxí yǔyán fāngmiàn, chíxù liànxí shì guānjiàn.
examples.en: In terms of learning languages, continuous practice is the key.

examples.cn: 在计划方面，我们应遵循灵活与创新的原则。
examples.pinyin: Zài jìhuà fāngmiàn, wǒmen yīng zūnshǒu líng huó yǔ chuàngxīn de yuánzé.
examples.en: In terms of planning, we should adhere to the principles of flexibility and innovation.

title: 不如 (bùrú) - Not as good as, inferior to
short_explanation: Used to make comparisons indicating that something or someone is not as good as something or someone else.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '不如 (bùrú)' is used to make comparisons, indicating that one thing or person is not as good as another. The term '不如' literally translates to 'not as good as', but can also be understood as 'inferior to'. This phrase is often used to compare qualities or states, suggesting a certain deficiency or insufficiency on the part of the person or thing being discussed.
formation: Subject + 不如 + Comparison Object + Comment

examples.cn: 这部电影不如他的上一部电影那么吸引人。
examples.pinyin: Zhè bù diànyǐng bùrú tā de shàng yī bù diànyǐng nàme xīyǐn rén.
examples.en: This movie is not as attractive as his previous one.

examples.cn: 在我看来，他不如他的哥哥那么聪明。
examples.pinyin: Zài wǒ kànlái, tā bùrú tā de gēgē nàme cōngmíng.
examples.en: In my opinion, he's not as smart as his brother.

examples.cn: 现在的生活不如以前简单。
examples.pinyin: Xiànzài de shēnghuó bùrú yǐqián jiǎndān.
examples.en: Life now is not as simple as before.

examples.cn: 我喜欢猫，但我不如你那么喜欢狗。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān māo, dàn wǒ bùrú nǐ nàme xǐhuān gǒu.
examples.en: I like cats, but I don't like dogs as much as you do.

title: 日益 (rìyì) - Increasingly, more and more
short_explanation: Used to express that something is increasing or growing over time.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '日益 (rìyì)' is a compound adverb used to describe an increasing or growing trend over time. It means something along the lines of 'increasingly', 'more and more' or 'day by day' in English.

examples.cn: 随着科技的发展，人们的生活日益便利。
examples.pinyin: Suízhe kējì de fāzhǎn, rénmen de shēnghuó rìyì biànlì.
examples.en: With the development of technology, people's lives are becoming increasingly convenient.

examples.cn: 由于全球变暖，极地冰山的融化速度日益加快。
examples.pinyin: Yóuyú quánqiú biàn nuǎn, jí dì bīngshān de rónghuà sùdù rìyì jiākuài.
examples.en: Due to global warming, the melting speed of the polar ice is increasingly accelerating.

examples.cn: 他的中文水平日益提高。
examples.pinyin: Tā de Zhōngwén shuǐpíng rìyì tígāo.
examples.en: His Chinese level is improving day by day.

examples.cn: 随着经济的快速发展，人们对健康生活的关注度日益加深。
examples.pinyin: Suízhe jīngjì de kuàisù fāzhǎn, rénmen duì jiànkāng shēnghuó de guānzhù dù rìyì jiāshēn.
examples.en: With rapid economic development, people's attention to a healthy life is deepening more and more.

title: 怎么办 (zěnme bàn) - What to do?
short_explanation: Used to express uncertainty about what course of action to take.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '怎么办 (zěnme bàn)' is a common expression used to ask for advice or to express uncertainty about what to do in a certain situation. In English, it is equivalent to asking 'what to do?'. This phrase is often utilized when someone is in a dilemma or a confusing situation and needs guidance or suggestions.
formation: Subject + 怎么办 + Rest of the sentence?

examples.cn: 我丢失了我的护照，我该怎么办？
examples.pinyin: Wǒ diūshī le wǒ de hùzhào, wǒ gāi zěnme bàn?
examples.en: I lost my passport, what should I do?

examples.cn: 电脑突然停止工作了，我怎么办？
examples.pinyin: Diànnǎo tūrán tíngzhǐ gōngzuò le, wǒ zěnme bàn?
examples.en: The computer suddenly stopped working, what to do?

examples.cn: 我不懂这个数学问题，怎么办？
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bù dǒng zhège shùxué wèntí, zěnme bàn?
examples.en: I don't understand this math problem, what should I do?

examples.cn: 我迷路了，我该怎么办？
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mílù le, wǒ gāi zěnme bàn?
examples.en: I'm lost, what should I do?

title: 无论如何 (wúlùn rúhé) - Anyway, anyhow, no matter what
short_explanation: Used to imply that regardless of the circumstances, the action or event will proceed.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '无论如何 (wúlùn rúhé)' is used to express that no matter what the situation or circumstance is, the action or event will proceed. It conveys an intention or determination to do something, regardless of obstacles or difficulties. The phrase can be translated to English as 'anyway', 'anyhow' or 'no matter what'.

examples.cn: 无论如何，我都会参加你的婚礼。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn rúhé, wǒ dōu huì cānjiā nǐ de hūnlǐ.
examples.en: Anyway, I will attend your wedding.

examples.cn: 无论如何，我们都必须完成这项任务。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn rúhé, wǒmen dōu bìxū wánchéng zhè xiàng rènwù.
examples.en: No matter what, we must complete this task.

examples.cn: 无论如何，你都应该尊重他人。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn rúhé, nǐ dōu yīnggāi zūnzhòng tārén.
examples.en: Anyway, you should respect others.

examples.cn: 无论如何，我都会支持你的决定。
examples.pinyin: Wúlùn rúhé, wǒ dōu huì zhīchí nǐ de juédìng.
examples.en: Anyway, I will support your decision.

title: 只要...就... (zhǐyào... jiù...) - As long as... then...
short_explanation: Used to express a condition and its result.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese grammar pattern '只要...就...' (zhǐyào... jiù...) is used to express a condition and its result. It's equivalent to 'as long as... then...' in English. This pattern usually indicates that the condition in the '只要' part is easy to satisfy, and once it is met, the result in the '就' part will happen.

examples.cn: 只要你努力学习，就会成功。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyào nǐ nǔlì xuéxí, jiù huì chénggōng.
examples.en: As long as you study hard, you will succeed.

examples.cn: 只要天气好，我们就去公园散步。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyào tiānqì hǎo, wǒmen jiù qù gōngyuán sànbù.
examples.en: As long as the weather is good, we will go for a walk in the park.

examples.cn: 只要你保持健康，就可以长寿。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyào nǐ bǎochí jiànkāng, jiù kěyǐ chángshòu.
examples.en: As long as you stay healthy, you can live a long life.

examples.cn: 只要有良好的心态，就能应对生活中的困难。
examples.pinyin: Zhǐyào yǒu liánghǎo de xīntài, jiù néng yìngduì shēnghuó zhōng de kùnnan.
examples.en: As long as you have a good mentality, you can deal with difficulties in life.

title: 任何 (rènhé) - Any, Whichever
short_explanation: Used to state that it doesn't matter who or what is being talked about.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '任何 (rènhé)' is a determiner used to refer to an indefinite quantity or number. It is equivalent to 'any' or 'whichever' in English. This phrase can be used irrespective of the nature, type, or quantity of the subject under discussion.
formation: '任何' + Noun + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 这家商店接受任何信用卡支付。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā shāngdiàn jiēshòu rènhé xìnyòngkǎ zhīfù.
examples.en: This shop accepts any credit card for payment.

examples.cn: 你可以在任何时间来参观我们的展览。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ kěyǐ zài rènhé shíjiān lái cānguān wǒmen de zhǎnlǚn.
examples.en: You can visit our exhibition at any time.

examples.cn: 在任何情况下，你都不能告诉他这个秘密。
examples.pinyin: Zài rènhé qíngkuàng xià, nǐ dōu bùnéng gàosù tā zhège mìmì.
examples.en: Under any circumstances, you cannot tell him this secret.

examples.cn: 如果你有任何疑问，请随时提出。
examples.pinyin: Rúguǒ nǐ yǒu rènhé yíwèn, qǐng suíshí tíchū.
examples.en: If you have any questions, please feel free to ask.

title: 无非 (wúfēi) - Nothing but, nothing more than
short_explanation: Used to indicate something is simply the way it is described, often downplaying its significance.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '无非 (wúfēi)' is commonly used in conversation to express that something is solely or just as explained, often diminishing its importance or impact. It is equivalent to saying 'nothing but' or 'nothing more than' in English. This term is usually employed when one is trying to emphasize that there isn't much depth or complexity to the point being discussed.
formation: Subject + 无非 + Verb/Adjective + Rest of sentence

examples.cn: 他无非是想你更好地理解他的立场而已。
examples.pinyin: Tā wú fēi shì xiǎng nǐ gèng hǎo dì lǐ jiě tā de lì chǎng ér yǐ.
examples.en: He simply wants you to better understand his position.

examples.cn: 这无非是一次普通的商业交易。
examples.pinyin: Zhè wúfēi shì yīcì pǔtōng de shāngyè jiāoyì.
examples.en: This is nothing more than a regular business transaction.

examples.cn: 他的建议无非想让我们更努力一点。
examples.pinyin: Tā de jiànyì wúfēi xiǎng ràng wǒmen gèng nǔlì yīdiǎn.
examples.en: His suggestion is nothing but a push for us to work harder.

examples.cn: 这个游戏无非是关于合作和团队精神的。
examples.pinyin: Zhège yóuxì wúfēi shì guānyú hézuò hé tuánduì jīngshén de.
examples.en: This game is nothing more than about collaboration and team spirit.

title: 即便 (jíbiàn) - Even if, Even though
short_explanation: Used to express a hypothetical condition, usually indicating a conceding circumstance or exception.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese term '即便 (jíbiàn)' is a conjunction that is equivalent to 'even if' or 'even though' in English. It is used to introduce a hypothetical condition or exception, often implying a resolution or persistence in spite of possible adversity or unfavourable conditions.
formation: 即便 + Hypothetical Condition/Situation, + Main Clause

examples.cn: 即便天气很冷，我也会去跑步。
examples.pinyin: Jíbiàn tiānqì hěn lěng, wǒ yě huì qù pǎobù.
examples.en: Even if the weather is very cold, I will go running.

examples.cn: 即便他不会来, 我们还是要等他。
examples.pinyin: Jíbiàn tā bú huì lái, wǒmen háishi yào děng tā.
examples.en: Even if he won't come, we still have to wait for him.

examples.cn: 他很聪明，即便任务很难，他也能完成。
examples.pinyin: Tā hěn cōngmíng, jíbiàn rènwù hěn nán, tā yě néng wánchéng.
examples.en: He is very smart, even if the task is difficult, he can still complete it.

examples.cn: 即便有工作，我也会抽时间去参观展览。
examples.pinyin: Jíbiàn yǒu gōngzuò, wǒ yě huì chōu shíjiān qù cānguān zhǎnlǎn.
examples.en: Even if I have work, I will make time to visit the exhibition.

title: 按照 (ànzhào) - According to
short_explanation: Used to indicate doing something according to a certain method, rule, or standard.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese phrase '按照 (ànzhào)' is used to show that someone is doing something based on a certain method, guideline, standard, or rule. It can be literally translated to English as 'according to', 'in accordance with', or 'based on'. You can use it when you want to express that something is being done according to a certain principle, norm, or basis.
formation: Subject + 按照 + Method / Rule / Standard + Verb + Rest of the sentence

examples.cn: 按照老师的建议，我决定每天学习一小时中文。
examples.pinyin: Ànzhào lǎoshī de jiànyì, wǒ juédìng měitiān xuéxí yī xiǎoshí Zhōngwén.
examples.en: According to the teacher's advice, I decided to study Chinese for one hour every day.

examples.cn: 按照这个配方做饭，你会得到一道美味的菜。
examples.pinyin: Ànzhào zhège pèifǎng zuòfàn, nǐ huì dédào yīdào měiwèi de cài.
examples.en: If you cook according to this recipe, you will get a delicious dish.

examples.cn: 按照地图，我们应该在这个十字路口右转。
examples.pinyin: Ànzhào dìtú, wǒmen yīnggāi zài zhège shízì lùkǒu yòu zhuǎn.
examples.en: According to the map, we should turn right at this intersection.

examples.cn: 按照他的计划，我们晚餐后立即去电影院。
examples.pinyin: Ànzhào tā de jìhuà, wǒmen wǎncān hòu lìjí qù diànyǐngyuàn.
examples.en: According to his plan, we will go to the cinema immediately after dinner.

title: 一...就... (yī... jiù...) - As soon as...
short_explanation: Used to indicate that the second action happens immediately after the first action.
long_explanation: The Mandarin Chinese pattern '一...就...' (yī... jiù...) translates to 'as soon as...'. It communicates the idea that a second action or situation occurs immediately or shortly after the first one. The pattern is often used to emphasise the shortness of the time interval between the two actions.

examples.cn: 一放学，他就回家做作业。
examples.pinyin: Yī fàngxué, tā jiù huí jiā zuò zuòyè.
examples.en: As soon as he finishes school, he goes home to do his homework.

examples.cn: 一到北京，我们就去参观长城。
examples.pinyin: Yī dào Běijīng, wǒmen jiù qù cānguān Chángchéng.
examples.en: As soon as we arrive in Beijing, we go to visit the Great Wall.

examples.cn: 一下雨就变冷。
examples.pinyin: Yī xiàyǔ jiù biàn lěng.
examples.en: As soon as it rains, it gets cold.

examples.cn: 一看到那个景色，他就高兴起来。
examples.pinyin: Yī kàndào nàgè jǐngsè, tā jiù gāoxìng qǐlái.
examples.en: As soon as he sees that scenery, he becomes happy.
